security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with no code execution, file system access, network calls, or environment variable access. Contains markdown files providing guidelines and conventions for plugin development.

content.value_statement: This repository lacks consistent conventions for plugin development. Developers struggle to follow correct patterns for creating, validating, and publishing Claude Code plugins. This skill provides the single source of truth for all repository-specific workflows and architectural rules.
actual_capabilities: Provides mandatory architectural rules and naming conventions for plugin development
Lists validation commands to verify plugin structure and syntax
Documents the correct directory layout for plugins, skills, and commands
References official Claude Code documentation for plugins, skills, and hooks
Describes Git conventions and commit message formats
Guides debugging steps for common plugin issues
limitations: Only applies to ancplua-claude-plugins repository, not general plugin development
Does not execute validation scripts or modify files automatically
Does not replace reading official Claude Code documentation for deep technical details
Does not provide code templates or generate plugin scaffolding

best_practices: Always run local-validate.sh before pushing changes
Use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for paths in configuration files instead of hardcoded absolute paths
Follow conventional commit messages for clear changelog generation
anti_patterns: Using absolute paths in plugin configurations
Modifying .claude-plugin/ directory for skills, commands, or hooks

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill supports Claude Code. It may work with other Claude products but is designed specifically for Claude Code plugin development.

faq.question: What are the validation limits?
faq.answer: Validation checks plugin manifests, shell scripts, markdown formatting, CI workflow syntax, and JSON validity. It does not test plugin runtime behavior.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other plugins?
faq.answer: Reference the marketplace.json for available plugins. MCP tools and hooks can reference other plugins using ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for portability.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a read-only documentation skill that provides guidelines. It does not access, modify, or transmit any user data.

faq.question: Why is my plugin not loading?
faq.answer: Common causes: invalid JSON in plugin.json, missing required fields, scripts not executable, or hardcoded paths. Run local-validate.sh and check Claude Code logs.

faq.question: How does this compare to official Claude Code docs?
faq.answer: This skill supplements official docs with repository-specific conventions. Always refer to code.claude.com for core functionality documentation.
